item.text: “And in the first year of Darius the Mede, I stood to strengthen him and to provide protection for him.)

Now I will tell you the truth.

“Three more kings will arise for Persia. Then a fourth king will be unusually rich, more so than all who preceded him. When he has amassed power through his riches, he will stir up everyone against the kingdom of Greece.

Then a <st data-num="01368" class="">powerful</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st><n id="1" /> will <st data-num="05975" class="">arise</st>, <st data-num="04910" class="">exercising</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">great</st> <st data-num="04474" class="">authority</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">doing</st> as he <st data-num="07522" class="">pleases</st>.

Shortly after his rise to power, his kingdom will be broken up and distributed toward the four winds of the sky—but not to his posterity or with the authority he exercised, for his kingdom will be uprooted and distributed to others besides these.
“Then the king of the south and one of his subordinates will grow strong. His subordinate will resist him and will rule a kingdom greater than his.

After some years have passed, they will form an alliance. Then the daughter of the king of the south will come to the king of the north to make an agreement, but she will not retain her power, nor will he continue in his strength. She, together with the one who brought her, her child, and her benefactor will all be delivered over at that time.
“There will arise in his place one from her family line who will come against their army and will enter the stronghold of the king of the north and will move against them successfully.

He will <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">take</st> their <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> into <st data-num="07628" class="">captivity</st> to <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, <st data-num="05973" class="">along with</st> their <st data-num="05257" class="">cast images</st> and <st data-num="02532" class="">prized</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">utensils</st> of <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>. Then <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> will <st data-num="05975" class="">withdraw</st> for some <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> from<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st>.

Then the king of the north<n id="1" /> will <st data-num="0935" class="">advance</st> against the <st data-num="04438" class="">empire</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st>, but will <st data-num="07725" class="">withdraw</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his own <st data-num="0127" class="">land</st>.
His sons will wage war, mustering a large army that will advance like an overflowing river and carrying the battle all the way to the enemy’s fortress.
“Then the king of the south will be enraged and will march out to fight against the king of the north, who will also muster a large army, but that army will be delivered into his hand.

When the <st data-num="01995" class="">army</st> is <st data-num="05375" class="">taken away</st>, the <st data-num="03824" class="">king of the south</st> will <st data-num="07311" class="">become arrogant</st>.<n id="1" /> He will <st data-num="05307" class="">be responsible for the death</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="07239" class="">thousands and thousands of people</st>,<n id="3" /> but he will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> continue to <st data-num="05810" class="">prevail</st>.
For the king of the north will again muster an army, one larger than before. At the end of some years he will advance with a huge army and enormous supplies.
“In those times many will oppose the king of the south. Those who are violent among your own people will rise up in confirmation of the vision, but they will falter.

Then the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> will <st data-num="0935" class="">advance</st> and will <st data-num="08210" class="">build</st> <st data-num="05550" class="">siege mounds</st> and <st data-num="03920" class="">capture</st> a <st data-num="04013" class="">well-fortified</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="02220" class="">forces</st> of the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">prevail</st>, not even his <st data-num="04005" class="">finest</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">contingents</st>.<n id="2" /> They will <st data-num="0369" class="">have no</st> <st data-num="03581" class="">strength</st> to <st data-num="05975" class="">prevail</st>.

The one <st data-num="0935" class="">advancing</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">against</st> him will <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> as he <st data-num="07522" class="">pleases</st>, and <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> one will be able to <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> him. He will <st data-num="05975" class="">prevail</st> in the <st data-num="06643" class="">beautiful</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>, and its <st data-num="03615" class="">annihilation</st> will be within his <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st>.<n id="1" />

His <st data-num="06440" class="">intention</st><n id="1" /> will <st data-num="07760" class="">be</st> to <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> with the <st data-num="08633" class="">strength</st> of his <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="04438" class="">kingdom</st>, and he will <st data-num="06213" class="">form</st> <st data-num="04339" class="">alliances</st>.<n id="2" /> He will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> the king of the south<n id="3" /> a <st data-num="01323 0802">daughter</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="05414" class="">in marriage</st> in order to <st data-num="07843" class="">destroy</st> the kingdom, but it will <st data-num="03808 03808">not</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">turn out</st> to his <st data-num="01961" class="">advantage</st>.

Then he will <st data-num="07725" class="">turn</st> his <st data-num="06440" class="">attention</st><n id="1" /> to the <st data-num="0339" class="">coastal regions</st> and will <st data-num="03920" class="">capture</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> of them. But a <st data-num="07101" class="">commander</st><n id="2" /> will <st data-num="07673" class="">bring</st> his <st data-num="02781" class="">shameful conduct</st> <st data-num="07673" class="">to a halt</st>; <st data-num="01115" class="">in addition</st>,<n id="3" /> he will <st data-num="07725" class="">make</st> him <st data-num="07725" class="">pay</st> for his <st data-num="02781" class="">shameful conduct</st>.<n id="4" />

He will then <st data-num="07725" class="">turn</st> his <st data-num="06440" class="">attention</st> to the <st data-num="04581" class="">fortresses</st> of his own <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>, but he will <st data-num="03782" class="">stumble</st> and <st data-num="05307" class="">fall</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> to be <st data-num="04672" class="">found</st> again.
There will arise after him one who will send out an exactor of tribute to enhance the splendor of the kingdom, but after a few days he will be destroyed, though not in anger or battle.

“Then there will arise in his place a despicable person to whom the royal honor has not been rightfully conferred. He will come on the scene in a time of prosperity and will seize the kingdom through deceit.

<st data-num="02220" class="">Armies</st><n id="1" /> will be <st data-num="07857" class="">suddenly</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="07857" class="">swept away</st> in defeat<n id="3" /> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> him; <st data-num="01571" class="">both</st> they and a <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st> <st data-num="05057" class="">leader</st><n id="4" /> will be <st data-num="07665" class="">destroyed</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="04480" class="">After</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02266" class="">entering into an alliance</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">with</st> him, he will <st data-num="06213" class="">behave</st> <st data-num="04820" class="">treacherously</st>; he will <st data-num="05927" class="">ascend</st> to <st data-num="06105" class="">power</st> with only a <st data-num="04592" class="">small</st> <st data-num="01471" class="">force</st>.<n id="2" />

In a <st data-num="07962">time of prosperity</st> for the most <st data-num="04924" class="">productive areas</st> of the <st data-num="04082" class="">province</st>, he will <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">accomplish</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">what</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">neither</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> nor <st data-num="01" class="">their</st> <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">accomplished</st>. He will <st data-num="0967" class="">distribute</st> <st data-num="0961" class="">loot</st>, <st data-num="07998" class="">spoils</st>, and <st data-num="07399" class="">property</st> to his <st data-num="01992" class="">followers</st>, and he will <st data-num="02803" class="">devise</st> <st data-num="04284" class="">plans</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> <st data-num="04013" class="">fortified cities</st>, but <st data-num="05704" class="">not for</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">long</st>.<n id="1" />

He will <st data-num="05782" class="">rouse</st> his <st data-num="03581" class="">strength</st> and <st data-num="03824" class="">enthusiasm</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st><n id="2" /> with a <st data-num="01419" class="">large</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st>. The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st> will <st data-num="01624" class="">wage</st> <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> with a <st data-num="01419" class="">large</st> and <st data-num="05704 03966">very</st> <st data-num="06099" class="">powerful</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st>, but he will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be able to <st data-num="05975" class="">prevail</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> of the <st data-num="04284" class="">plans</st> <st data-num="02803" class="">devised</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> him.

Those who <st data-num="0398" class="">share</st> the king’s <st data-num="06598" class="">fine food</st> will attempt to <st data-num="07665" class="">destroy</st> him, and his <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> will be <st data-num="07857" class="">swept away</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07227">many</st> will be <st data-num="05307 02491">killed in battle</st>.

These <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st>, their <st data-num="03824" class="">minds</st><n id="1" /> filled with <st data-num="04827" class="">evil intentions</st>, will <st data-num="01696" class="">trade</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03577" class="">lies</st> with one another <st data-num="05921">at</st> the <st data-num="0259" class="">same</st> <st data-num="07979" class="">table</st>. But it will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="06743" class="">succeed</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> there is <st data-num="05750" class="">still</st> an <st data-num="07093" class="">end</st> at the <st data-num="04150" class="">appointed time</st>.

Then the king of the north<n id="1" /> will <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> to his own <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> with <st data-num="01419" class="">much</st> <st data-num="07399" class="">property</st>. His <st data-num="03824" class="">mind</st> will be set <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st>. He will <st data-num="06213" class="">take action</st>, and then <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> to his own <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.

At an <st data-num="04150" class="">appointed time</st> he will <st data-num="07725" class="">again</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">invade</st> the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st>, but this <st data-num="0314" class="">latter</st> visit will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">turn out</st> the way the <st data-num="07223" class="">former one</st> did.

The <st data-num="06716" class="">ships</st> of <st data-num="03794" class="">Kittim</st><n id="1" /> will <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> against him, leaving him <st data-num="03512" class="">disheartened</st>.<n id="2" /> He will <st data-num="07725" class="">turn back</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">direct</st> his <st data-num="02194" class="">indignation</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st>. He will <st data-num="07725" class="">return</st> and <st data-num="0995 05921">honor</st><n id="3" /> those who <st data-num="05800" class="">forsake</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st>.

His <st data-num="02220" class="">forces</st><n id="1" /> will <st data-num="05975" class="">rise up</st> and <st data-num="02490" class="">profane</st> the <st data-num="04581" class="">fortified</st> <st data-num="04720" class="">sanctuary</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05493" class="">stopping</st> the <st data-num="08548" class="">daily sacrifice</st>. In its place they will <st data-num="05414" class="">set up</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="08251" class="">abomination</st> that <st data-num="08074" class="">causes desolation</st>.

Then with <st data-num="02514" class="">smooth words</st> he will <st data-num="02610" class="">defile</st><n id="1" /> those who have <st data-num="07561" class="">rejected</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st>. But the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> who are <st data-num="03045" class="">loyal to</st><n id="3" /> their <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> will <st data-num="06213" class="">act</st> <st data-num="02388" class="">valiantly</st>.<n id="4" />

These who are <st data-num="07919" class="">wise</st> among the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> will <st data-num="0995" class="">teach</st> the <st data-num="07227" class="">masses</st>.<n id="1" /> However, they will <st data-num="03782" class="">fall</st><n id="2" /> by the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> and by the <st data-num="03852" class="">flame</st>,<n id="3" /> and they will be <st data-num="07628" class="">imprisoned</st> and <st data-num="0961" class="">plundered</st> for some <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st>.<n id="4" />

When they <st data-num="03782" class="">stumble</st>, they will be <st data-num="05826" class="">granted</st> <st data-num="04592" class="">some</st> <st data-num="05828" class="">help</st>. But <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> will <st data-num="03867" class="">unite</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> them <st data-num="02519" class="">deceitfully</st>.
Even some of the wise will stumble, resulting in their refinement, purification, and cleansing until the time of the end, for it is still for the appointed time.

“Then the king will do as he pleases. He will exalt and magnify himself above every deity, and he will utter presumptuous things against the God of gods. He will succeed until the time of wrath is completed, for what has been decreed must occur.

He will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05921 0995">respect</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> of his <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st>—not even the god <st data-num="02532" class="">loved</st> by <st data-num="0802" class="">women</st>.<n id="2" /> He will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05921 0995">respect</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0433" class="">god</st>; he will <st data-num="01431" class="">elevate</st> himself <st data-num="05921" class="">above</st> them <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st>.

<st data-num="05921 03653">What</st> he will <st data-num="03513" class="">honor</st> <st data-num="05921 03653">is</st> a <st data-num="0433" class="">god</st> of <st data-num="04581" class="">fortresses</st>—a <st data-num="0433 0834">god</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">acknowledge</st> he will <st data-num="03513" class="">honor</st> with <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, <st data-num="03368" class="">valuable</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>, and <st data-num="02530" class="">treasured commodities</st>.

He will attack mighty fortresses, aided by a foreign deity. To those who recognize him he will grant considerable honor. He will place them in authority over many people, and he will parcel out land for a price.

“At the time of the end the king of the south will attack him. Then the king of the north will storm against him with chariots, horsemen, and a large armada of ships. He will invade lands, passing through them like an overflowing river.

Then he will <st data-num="0935" class="">enter</st> the <st data-num="06643" class="">beautiful</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07227" class="">Many</st><n id="2" /> will <st data-num="03782" class="">fall</st>, but <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> will <st data-num="04422 03027">escape</st>:<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st>, <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>, and the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonite</st> <st data-num="07225" class="">leadership</st>.

He will <st data-num="07971" class="">extend</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st><n id="1" /> against other <st data-num="0776" class="">lands</st>; the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01961 06413">escape</st>.

He will <st data-num="04910" class="">have control</st> over the <st data-num="04362" class="">hidden stores</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> and <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, as well as <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02530" class="">treasures</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>. <st data-num="03864" class="">Libyans</st> and <st data-num="03569" class="">Ethiopians</st><n id="1" /> will <st data-num="04703" class="">submit</st> to him.<n id="2" />

But <st data-num="08052" class="">reports</st> will <st data-num="0926" class="">trouble</st> him from the <st data-num="04217" class="">east</st> and <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st>, and he will <st data-num="03318" class="">set out</st> in a <st data-num="01419" class="">tremendous</st> <st data-num="02534" class="">rage</st> to <st data-num="08045" class="">destroy</st> and <st data-num="02763" class="">wipe out</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st>.
He will pitch his royal tents between the seas toward the beautiful holy mountain. But he will come to his end, with no one to help him.
